infodynamics.measures.continuous
Interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate

All Known Implementing Classes:
ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian, ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
public interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate

Interface for multivariate implementations of the conditional mutual information.

Intended usage of the child classes:

  1. Construct
  2. Set properties using setProperty(String, String)
  3. #initialise(int, int) or #initialise(int, int, double)
  4. Provide the observations to the calculator using: #setObservations(double[][], double[][]), or #setCovariance(double[][]), or a sequence of: startAddObservations(), multiple calls to either #addObservations(double[][], double[][]) or #addObservations(double[][], double[][], int, int), and then finaliseAddObservations().
  5. Compute the required information-theoretic results, primarily: computeAverageLocalOfObservations() to return the average value based on the supplied observations; or other calls to compute local values or statistical significance.

Author:
Joseph Lizier, joseph.lizier at gmail.com
See Also:
"T. M. Cover and J. A. Thomas, 'Elements of Information Theory' (John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1991)."

                     double[][] var2,

                     throws java.lang.Exception

Sets the single set of observations to compute the PDFs from. Cannot be called in conjunction with startAddObservations()/#addObservations(double[], double[], double[]) / finaliseAddObservations().

Parameters:
var1 - multivariate observations for variable 1 (first index is time, second is variable number)
var2 - multivariate observations for variable 2 (first index is time, second is variable number)
cond - multivariate observations for the conditional (first index is time, second is variable number)

addObservations

void addObservations(double[][] var1,
                     double[][] var2,
                     double[][] cond)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after startAddObservations(); call finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

Note that the arrays must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

Parameters:
var1 - multivariate observations for variable 1 (first index is time, second is variable number)
var2 - multivariate observations for variable 2 (first index is time, second is variable number)
cond - multivariate observations for the conditional (first index is time, second is variable number)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

addObservations

void addObservations(double[][] var1,
                     double[][] var2,
                     double[][] cond,
                     int startTime,
                     int numTimeSteps)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after startAddObservations(); call finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

Note that the arrays must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

Parameters:
var1 - multivariate observations for variable 1 (first index is time, second is variable number)
var2 - multivariate observations for variable 2 (first index is time, second is variable number)
cond - multivariate observations for the conditional (first index is time, second is variable number)
startTime - first time index to take observations on
numTimeSteps - number of time steps to use
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

computeAverageLocalOfObservations

double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
Returns:
the average value of the conditional mutual information measure, computed using all of the previously supplied observation sets.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

computeLocalOfPreviousObservations

double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception

Computes the local values of the conditional mutual information, for each valid observation in the previously supplied observations (with PDFs computed using all of the previously supplied observation sets).

If disjoint observations were supplied using several calls such as ChannelCalculator.addObservations(double[], double[]) then the local values for each disjoint observation set will be appended here to create a single return array, though of course the time series for these disjoint observations were not appended in computing the required PDFs).

Returns:
array of local values.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

computeSignificance

EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int variableToReorder,
                                                     int numPermutationsToCheck)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception

Compute the significance of obtaining the given average measure from the given observations.

This is in the spirit of Chavez et. al., "Statistical assessment of nonlinear causality: application to epileptic EEG signals", Journal of Neuroscience Methods 124 (2003) 113-128.

Basically, we shuffle the observations of the named variable against the other tuples. This keeps the marginal and joint PDFs of the unshuffled variables the same but destroys any correlation between the named variable and the others.

Parameters:
variableToReorder - 1 for variable 1, 2 for variable 2
numPermutationsToCheck - number of new orderings of the source values to compare against
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
"Chavez et. al., 'Statistical assessment of nonlinear causality: application to epileptic EEG signals', Journal of Neuroscience Methods 124 (2003) 113-128"

computeSignificance

EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int variableToReorder,
                                                     int[][] newOrderings)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception

As per computeSignificance(int, int) but supplies the re-orderings of the observations of the named variable.

Parameters:
variableToReorder - 1 for variable 1, 2 for variable 2
newOrderings - first index is permutation number, i.e. newOrderings[i] is an array of 1 permutation of 0..n-1, where there were n observations. If the length of each permutation in newOrderings is not equal to numObservations, an Exception is thrown.
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
